aderes to the AWS best practices so
let's dive right into
it this is the first video out of a

architected L for Dynamo
DB here is our table of content for the

the next videos in the series will each

performance efficiency cost optimization
and so
on let's start with looking into what a
workit review actually is the AWS
architected framework enables customers
to improve their cloud-based
architectures and better understand the
business impact of their design
decisions it provides a mechanism for
regularly evaluating workloads
identifying high-risk issues and
recording improvements by running a
architect review a customer will learn
the best practices for architecting in
the cloud measure their architecture
against these best practices using a
consistent and repeatable process and
will finally improve the identified gaps
using the architected
resources the architected review focuses
on these six pillars the first one is
operational excellence which focuses on
running and monitoring systems and
continually improving processes and
procedures the security pillar focuses
on protecting information and protecting
systems the reliability pillar focuses
on workloads performing their intended
functions and how to recover quickly
from failure to meet the demand the
performance effic Ive pillar focuses on
efficient usage of compute resources to
achieve Optimal Performance for your
application the cost optimization pillar
focuses on avoiding unnecessary costs
and controlling costs over time and
finally the sustainability pillar
focuses on minimizing the environmental
impact of running Cloud
workloads a well architected review
looks at a workload from a general
technology perspective which means it
cannot provide workload and service
specific
advice that's why we created the
architected lens for Dynamo DB which
provides best practices design
principles and questions to assess and
review a specific Dynam DB workload by
performing this review you will make a
better designed and optimal use of
Dynamo DB in your workload while
focusing on each of the previously
mentioned six
pillars a Dynamo DBW architected lens
review is usually performed by an AWS
Solutions architect to together with the
customer and for each pillar it includes
reviewing the design principles for that
pillar and answering a pretty fine list
of questions about the specific workload
at the end of the review the customer
receives a detailed Report with the
identified risk grouped by severity and
the proposed action items you can find
the Dynamo DB architected lens questions
at the link shown on the slide so a
customer can also perform this review as
a self-service let's demonstrate how
this process looks like
